subject: Self Care
title: The Evening Wind-Down
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Evening Wind-Down.

hook.text: You scroll until midnight, sleep badly, and start tomorrow exhausted. The evening routine was missing.

buildup.text: Evening routines signal the brain to begin shutting down. They are the bridge between work mode and rest.

discovery.text: Effective wind-downs include screen limits, reflection, and relaxation â€” in that order and at the same time.

twist.text: The evening routine actually determines tomorrow's morning. Bad nights create bad mornings reliably.

climax.text: Set a hard stop for screens. Write tomorrow's priorities. Read or stretch. Sleep follows more easily.

punchline.text: A good morning starts the night before.

quiz.question: Why does the evening routine affect the next morning?
